title: fix nightly warning in network drain
Update lib documentation
body:
The documentation of `sozu_lib` was completely obsolete, even before introducing protobuf.

I made the documentation more verbose and gave it context too.

title: Remove acme command
body:
* We remove acme command in favor of already existing bot implementation. We want to provide a better integration than this one with a fully automated implementation like caddy or nginx provide. You could take a look of advancement on this issue #926 
* We remove this command to remove the last dependency to openssl in favor of rustls

title: Cosmetic todos
body: Some TODOs were obsolete because the changes were implemented already, others were easy enough.

title: chore(e2e): use rustls instead of openssl
Bump dependencies
body:
* Bump lib dependencies
* Bump command dependencies
* Bump e2e dependencies
* Bump binary dependencies

title: remove JSON serialization tests
body:
Since Sōzu now uses protobuf to serialize and deserialize types in binary, there is no need for testing JSON serialization.

Merge #921 first.

title: Document protobuf
body: This updates the README of sozu-command-lib

title: Write response in protobuf
body:
This writes the big Response type in protobuf, and together with it, embedded types like `ListedFrontends`, that were not already translated in protobuf.

A key aspect is that we have type pairs to fullfill different functions. As an example:
- `HttpFrontend` is used *within* Sōzu to describe an HTTP or HTTPS frontend, with its socket address being of the type `SocketAddr`
- `RequestHttpFrontend` is used *without* Sōzu, to send requests to it, with a socket address being a simple `string`.
 
Types used for requests are used as well in the responses. That means `ListedFrontends` contains a list of `RequestHttpFrontend` because this type is fit for communication to and from Sōzu.

If these "outside" type should be renamed differently, is up for debate.

title: write Request in protobuf
body: The generated Rust with protobuf `oneof` is not pretty, but it's the only solution to translate the way Rust puts payload in enums.

title: Better check on session limits
body:
As revealed by #916 , and highlighted by #917 , we need to have better checks on the sessions.

This PR rewrites a bit the methods of `SessionManager`, and is intended to fix the aforementioned issues.

title: Fix a reconnection issue
body:
This covers #914:
- add blue green e2e test
- fix close session (backend_token are not passed as frontend tokens anymore)
- fix http reconnection with backend entry reuse (do not remove backend entry anymore)
- fix http behavior e2e test

title: update rustls to 0.21.0
body:
as requested in 

- #911

title: Replace RouteKey with string
body:
HTTP and HTTPS Frontends are stored in `ConfigState` using `RouteKey` as a key in BTreeMaps. RouteKey is a sum-up of what makes a frontend unique: address, hostname, path rule. Thus we avoid collisions in the BTreeMap.

```rust
struct ConfigState {
     // ...
     pub http_fronts: BTreeMap<RouteKey, HttpFrontend>
}
```

```rust
pub struct RouteKey {
    pub address: String,
    hostname: String,
    pub path_rule: PathRule,
    pub method: Option<String>,
}
```

Using a struct as key in a map is difficult to translate and serialize in protobuf though, so instead of using RouteKey I rewrote the maps to use a String as key, and this string is the exact same thing RouteKey was serialized to.

Since they are no more uses for RouteKey, I removed it.

Also, ConfigState has a `https_fronts` field but it is never populated. The HTTPS frontends are stored in `http_fronts`. So I removed the `https_fronts` field altogether, and then decided to populate it instead.

title: Refactor listeners socket addresses
body:
In order to write these in protobuf:

- `HttpListenerConfig`
- `HttpsListenerConfig`
- `TcpListenerConfig`

We need to remove the `SocketAddr` types they contain and use `String` instead. Parsing to `SocketAddr` will be done a bit everywhere but only `String` will be passed between processes.

This PR also adds an `active` field on these listener configs. `active` is set to `false` by default, we need an `ActivateListener` request to set them to true.

title: protobuf types
body:
In order to have other APIs send requests to Sōzu, we will define `Request`, `Response` and `State` in protobuf.

This PR translates the contained types in protobuf, step by step.

title: Adapt for protobuf
body:
- Finish flattening the `Request` enum
- remove the `Route` struct from `HttpFrontend`, for better protobuf translation

title: Rework response for protobuf
body: In order to translate the Sōzu command lib Request, Response and State to protobuf, we need to rewrite the convoluted types the ResponseContent into better named, less intricated versions of themselves.

title: Refactor config
body:
In order to fit in protobuf, we need to get rid of `SocketAddr` as a type in the requests that Sōzu receives.

This PR:
- rewrites parts of how the TOML config is parsed, using a intermediate struct `ConfigBuilder`
- introduces a builder pattern for `Listener`

title: Command lib: simplify Request
body:
In order to rewrite parts of the Sōzu command lib in protobuf, we need to prepare it for the change.

For now, a `Request` to Sōzu looks like this:

```rust
struct Request {
    id: String,
    version: u8,
    worker_id: Option<u32>,
    content: RequestContent,
}
```
where RequestContent is an enum:

```rust
enum RequestContent {
     Proxy(ProxyRequestOrder),
     Status,
     // ...
}
```

and `ProxyRequestOrder` is an enum itself.

This PR:

- removes `id` and `version` and `worker_id` from Request so that it becomes `RequestContent`
- flattens all orders of `ProxyRequestOrder` into `RequestContent`
- renames `RequestContent` to `Order`

Now Sōzu takes only `Order` in. When it sends orders to its workers or when it stores it for itself, it puts them in an `InnerOrder` that does have an id:

```rust
pub struct InnerOrder {
    pub id: MessageId,
    pub content: Order,
}
```

title: Update return for get_executable_path (freebsd)
body: The FreeBSD build was failing as the function was still returning `String` instead of an `anyhow::Result<String>`

milestone.title: HTTP2
milestone.description:
For various reasons we need Sōzu to implement the [HTTP2 protocol](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9113). This requires a great deal of tasks and refactoring everywhere.

We want Sōzu to be able to:

- passthrough HTTP1.1
- passthrough HTTP2
- translate from one to the other and vice-versa

An important piece of the solution lies in developping a library called [Kawa](https://github.com/CleverCloud/kawa), a generic HTTP representation, and integrate it into Sōzu. As of august 2023, Kawa handles HTTP1.1 in Sōzu.

body:
In order to support HTTP2 in Sōzu, there is a number of steps to take. This is one of them.

This PR aims to normalize the `State`s of the various protocols (`Expect`, `Pipe`...), and to make them handle backend connection.

A side effect of this refactoring is to merge duplicate code of the `http` and `https` proxies into the `Http` state.

title: End to end tests proof of concept
body:
We want to test Sōzu's lib to be sure that all corner cases are checked.
This is intended for local development and inclusion in the CI.

title: Add default variables
body: Salut @Keruspe je propose d'ajouter les variables avec les valeurs par défaut mentionnées dans la documentation. De ce fait, le script sera utilisable sans apporter de modification. Libre à l'utilisateur d'adapter les variables à son cas si besoin.
